channel.title: governing body on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Faroe Islands Football Association Logo The Faroe Islands Football Association, or FSF, is the governing body of all domestic football in the Faroe Islands, the highest level of which is the Faroe Islands Premier League. It also runs the Faroe Islands national teams for men and women. Established in 1979, it is based in Tórshavn. Source
You can download theFaroe Islands Football Associationlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Faroe Islands Football Association
item.description: The Faroe Islands Football Association, or FSF, is the governing body of all domestic football in the Faroe Islands, the highest level of which is the Faroe Islands Premier League. It also runs the Faroe Islands national teams for men and women. Established in 1979, it is based in Tórshavn. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Football Association of Albania Logo
The Albanian Football Association is the governing body of football in Albania. The association is based in Tirana, Albania. It organises the national football leagues of the Albanian Superliga, the First Division, the Second Division, the Third Division, the Albanian Cup and Supercup. Albania women’s national football team, Albanian women’s football championship, and the Albanian Women’s Cup are also overseen. The association also coordinates the activities of the Albania national football team and the Albania national youth football teams such as Under-21, Under-20, Under-19, Under-18, Under-17, Under-16 and Under-15.
You can download theFootball Association of Albanialogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Football Association of Albania
item.description: The Albanian Football Association is the governing body of football in Albania. The association is based in Tirana, Albania. It organises the national football leagues of the Albanian Superliga, the First Division, the Second Division, the Third Division, the Albanian Cup and Supercup. Albania women’s national football team, Albanian women’s football championship, and the Albanian Women’s Cup are also overseen. The association also coordinates the activities of the Albania national football team and the Albania national youth football teams such as Under-21, Under-20, Under-19, Under-18, Under-17, Under-16 and Under-15.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Football Association of Finland Logo
The Football Association of Finland is the governing body of football in Finland. It was founded in Helsinki on 19 May 1907. The SPL organises the men’s and women’s national football teams, and the second and third tiers of national football. The premier division Veikkausliiga is organized by a distinct organisation, and the lower tiers are organized by the 12 district organisations. The SPL is based in the Finnish capital city of Helsinki.
You can download theFootball Association of Finlandlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Football Association of Finland
item.description: The Football Association of Finland is the governing body of football in Finland. It was founded in Helsinki on 19 May 1907. The SPL organises the men’s and women’s national football teams, and the second and third tiers of national football. The premier division Veikkausliiga is organized by a distinct organisation, and the lower tiers are organized by the 12 district organisations. The SPL is based in the Finnish capital city of Helsinki.

<! [CDATA[
Football Association of Iceland Logo The Football Association of Iceland is the governing body of football in Iceland. It was founded on 26 March 1947, joined FIFA the same year, and UEFA in 1954. It organises the football league, Úrvalsdeild, and the Iceland men’s national football team and Iceland women’s national football team. It is based in Reykjavík. Source
You can download theFootball Association of Icelandlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

<! [CDATA[
Football Association of Moldova Logo The Moldovan Football Federation is the governing body of football in Moldova. It organizes all the football leagues, including the top-tier league Moldovan National Division, and the Moldova national football team. It is based in Chișinău. The current president is Leonid Oleinicenco. Source
You can download theFootball Association of Moldovalogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Football Association of Moldova
item.description: The Moldovan Football Federation is the governing body of football in Moldova. It organizes all the football leagues, including the top-tier league Moldovan National Division, and the Moldova national football team. It is based in Chișinău. The current president is Leonid Oleinicenco. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Football Association of Montenegro Logo
The Football Association of Montenegro is the governing body of football in Montenegro. It is based in the capital, Podgorica. The FSCG organises the Montenegrin First, Second and Third Leagues, which between them contain 45 clubs. It also organises the Montenegrin Women’s League and the men’s and women’s Montenegrin Cups, as well as the Montenegro national football team and the Montenegro national under-21 football team. The FSCG was established in 1931 as a sub-association within the Football Association of Yugoslavia.
You can download theFootball Association of Montenegrologo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Football Association of Montenegro
item.description: The Football Association of Montenegro is the governing body of football in Montenegro. It is based in the capital, Podgorica. The FSCG organises the Montenegrin First, Second and Third Leagues, which between them contain 45 clubs. It also organises the Montenegrin Women’s League and the men’s and women’s Montenegrin Cups, as well as the Montenegro national football team and the Montenegro national under-21 football team. The FSCG was established in 1931 as a sub-association within the Football Association of Yugoslavia.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Football Association of Norway Logo The Football Association of Norway is the governing body of football in Norway. It was formed in 1902 and organises the men’s and women’s national teams, as well as the league systems for men and women. The current president of NFF is Terje Svendsen. By 1 January 2004, there were 1,814 clubs organized in Norway and 373,532 registered players. It is the largest sports federation in Norway. Source
You can download theFootball Association of Norwaylogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Football Association of Norway
item.description: The Football Association of Norway is the governing body of football in Norway. It was formed in 1902 and organises the men’s and women’s national teams, as well as the league systems for men and women. The current president of NFF is Terje Svendsen. By 1 January 2004, there were 1,814 clubs organized in Norway and 373,532 registered players. It is the largest sports federation in Norway. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Football Association of Serbia Logo
The Football Association of Serbia is the governing body of football in Serbia, based in Belgrade. It organizes Serbian football leagues, namely the Serbian Superliga, the Serbia national football team, as well as the Second Leagues. FSS was part of the Football Association of Yugoslavia, which was founded in 1919 in Zagreb then the new Football Association of Serbia and Montenegro in 2003. It was established as Football Association of Serbia in 2006 after the split of Montenegro and Serbia as two different independent countries.
You can download theFootball Association of Serbialogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Football Association of Serbia
item.description: The Football Association of Serbia is the governing body of football in Serbia, based in Belgrade. It organizes Serbian football leagues, namely the Serbian Superliga, the Serbia national football team, as well as the Second Leagues. FSS was part of the Football Association of Yugoslavia, which was founded in 1919 in Zagreb then the new Football Association of Serbia and Montenegro in 2003. It was established as Football Association of Serbia in 2006 after the split of Montenegro and Serbia as two different independent countries.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Football Association of Slovenia Logo The Football Association of Slovenia is the governing body of football in Slovenia. It organizes the first division, second division, third division, Slovenian Cup, Slovenian Women’s League, and other competitions. It is also responsible for the Slovenia national football team and the Slovenia women’s national football team. It was founded as Ljubljana Football Subassociation on 24 April 1920. Source
You can download theFootball Association of Slovenialogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Football Association of Slovenia
item.description: The Football Association of Slovenia is the governing body of football in Slovenia. It organizes the first division, second division, third division, Slovenian Cup, Slovenian Women’s League, and other competitions. It is also responsible for the Slovenia national football team and the Slovenia women’s national football team. It was founded as Ljubljana Football Subassociation on 24 April 1920. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Football Association of Wales Logo
The Football Association of Wales is the governing body of association football and futsal in Wales, and controls the Welsh national football team, its corresponding women’s team, as well as the Welsh national futsal team. It is a member of FIFA, UEFA and the IFAB. Established in 1876, it is the third-oldest national association in the world, and one of the four associations, along with the English Football Association, Scottish Football Association, Irish Football Association and FIFA, that make up the International Football Association Board, responsible for the Laws of the Game.
You can download theFootball Association of Waleslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Football Association of Wales
item.description: The Football Association of Wales is the governing body of association football and futsal in Wales, and controls the Welsh national football team, its corresponding women’s team, as well as the Welsh national futsal team. It is a member of FIFA, UEFA and the IFAB. Established in 1876, it is the third-oldest national association in the world, and one of the four associations, along with the English Football Association, Scottish Football Association, Irish Football Association and FIFA, that make up the International Football Association Board, responsible for the Laws of the Game.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Football Federation of Armenia Logo
The Football Federation of Armenia is the governing body of association football in Armenia. Its headquarters are located in Yerevan. It organizes the Armenian Premier League, the Armenian First League, the Armenian Super Cup, the Armenian Independence Cup and the Armenian Futsal Premier League. It is also responsible for appointing the management of the Armenian national football team, and the Armenia women’s national football team. The Armenian national futsal team is also managed by the federation.
You can download theFootball Federation of Armenialogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Football Federation of Armenia
item.description: The Football Federation of Armenia is the governing body of association football in Armenia. Its headquarters are located in Yerevan. It organizes the Armenian Premier League, the Armenian First League, the Armenian Super Cup, the Armenian Independence Cup and the Armenian Futsal Premier League. It is also responsible for appointing the management of the Armenian national football team, and the Armenia women’s national football team. The Armenian national futsal team is also managed by the federation.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Football Federation of Kosovo Logo The Football Federation of Kosovo is the governing body of football in Kosovo, with headquarters in Pristina. The Football Federation of Kosovo was established in 1946 as a branch of the Football Association of Yugoslavia, it has since become independent and was headed by Fadil Vokrri until his sudden death in 2018. It organizes eight competitions of football in Kosovo. Source
You can download theFootball Federation of Kosovologo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Football Federation of Kosovo
item.description: The Football Federation of Kosovo is the governing body of football in Kosovo, with headquarters in Pristina. The Football Federation of Kosovo was established in 1946 as a branch of the Football Association of Yugoslavia, it has since become independent and was headed by Fadil Vokrri until his sudden death in 2018. It organizes eight competitions of football in Kosovo. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Football Union of Russia Logo
The Russian Football Union is the official governing body of the sport of football in the Russian Federation. With headquarters in Moscow, it organizes Russian amateur and professional football, including the men’s, women’s, youth, beach football, futsal and Paralympic national teams. The RFS sanctions referees and football tournaments for Russian Football Premier League and most football leagues in Russia. RFS is headed by Aleksandr Dyukov, the CEO of Gazprom Neft.
You can download theFootball Union of Russialogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Football Union of Russia
item.description: The Russian Football Union is the official governing body of the sport of football in the Russian Federation. With headquarters in Moscow, it organizes Russian amateur and professional football, including the men’s, women’s, youth, beach football, futsal and Paralympic national teams. The RFS sanctions referees and football tournaments for Russian Football Premier League and most football leagues in Russia. RFS is headed by Aleksandr Dyukov, the CEO of Gazprom Neft.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
French Football Federation Logo
The French Football Federation is the governing body of football in France. It also includes the overseas departments and the overseas collectivities and also Monaco. It was formed in 1919 and is based in the capital, Paris. The FFF was a founding member of FIFA and is responsible for overseeing all aspects of the game of football in France, both professional and amateur. The French Football Federation is a founding member of UEFA and joined FIFA in 1907 after replacing the USFSA, who were founding members.
You can download theFrench Football Federationlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: French Football Federation
item.description: The French Football Federation is the governing body of football in France. It also includes the overseas departments and the overseas collectivities and also Monaco. It was formed in 1919 and is based in the capital, Paris. The FFF was a founding member of FIFA and is responsible for overseeing all aspects of the game of football in France, both professional and amateur. The French Football Federation is a founding member of UEFA and joined FIFA in 1907 after replacing the USFSA, who were founding members.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Estonian Football Association Logo
The Estonian Football Association is the governing body of football, beach soccer and futsal in Estonia, established on 14 December 1921. It organizes the football league, including the championship which is called Meistriliiga, Estonian Cup and the Estonian national football team. It is based in Tallinn. EJL became a member of FIFA in 1923, but following Estonia’s annexation by the Soviet Union it was disbanded. It became a member again in 1992 after Estonia reinstated its independence.
You can download theEstonianlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Estonian
item.description: The Estonian Football Association is the governing body of football, beach soccer and futsal in Estonia, established on 14 December 1921. It organizes the football league, including the championship which is called Meistriliiga, Estonian Cup and the Estonian national football team. It is based in Tallinn. EJL became a member of FIFA in 1923, but following Estonia’s annexation by the Soviet Union it was disbanded. It became a member again in 1992 after Estonia reinstated its independence.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Danish Football Association Logo The Danish Football Union is the governing body of football in Denmark. It is the organization of the Danish football clubs and runs the professional Danish football leagues and the men’s and women’s national teams. It is based in the city of Brøndby and is a founding member of both FIFA and UEFA. The DBU has also been the governing body of futsal in Denmark since 2008. Source
You can download theDBUlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: DBU
item.description: The Danish Football Union is the governing body of football in Denmark. It is the organization of the Danish football clubs and runs the professional Danish football leagues and the men’s and women’s national teams. It is based in the city of Brøndby and is a founding member of both FIFA and UEFA. The DBU has also been the governing body of futsal in Denmark since 2008. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Democratic National Committee Logo
The Democratic National Committee is the governing body of the United States Democratic Party. The committee coordinates strategy to support Democratic Party candidates throughout the country for local, state, and national office. It organizes the Democratic National Convention held every four years to nominate a candidate for President of the United States and to formulate the party platform. While it provides support for party candidates, it does not have direct authority over elected officials.
You can download theDNClogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: DNC

The committee coordinates strategy to support Democratic Party candidates throughout the country for local, state, and national office. It organizes the Democratic National Convention held every four years to nominate a candidate for President of the United States and to formulate the party platform. While it provides support for party candidates, it does not have direct authority over elected officials.
